p: This studies of larvicidal activity of Senna occidentalis root n-hexane, ethyl acetate, and methanol extracts had LD 50 values 1564721 ppm, 1412.54 ppm, and 1412.54 ppm, respectively, and were carried out against 3 rd instar of Culex quinquefasciatus mosquito larvae ( Table 5), which revealed that the results of the lethal doses determined in both n-hexane and ethyl acetate extracts were larvicidal significant ( p < 0.05) and highly effectively safe for mosquito larvae with increased LD 50 values of 1564721 and 1412.54, respectively, and this indicates that nonpolar ( n-hexane) and intermediate polar ethyl acetate have more potent activity to larvae. The methanol extract showed least effective larvicidal significant ( p < 0.05) moderate effect for mosquito larvae with an LD 50 value 257.54 ppm.
